term.title: separation number

item.text: This expresses the number of peaks which can be resolved in a given part of the chromatogram between the peaks of two consecutive n-alkanes with z and (z + 1) carbon atoms in their molecules: SN = t R z + 1- t R z w h z + w (trennzahl) is commonly used to express the separation number. As the separation number depends on the n-alkanes used for the calculation, they always must be specified with any given SN value.

item.alttext: SN = t R z + 1- t R z w h z + w

sources.item: PAC, 1993, 65, 819. 'Nomenclature for chromatography (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' on page 847 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199365040819)
